channel.title: Making ONE shop use Tokkul
channel.description:
Hello, might have seen my post earlier but i'm in the process of fixing my Fighting Caves area and i have if you kill any tzhaar monster you get some tokkul and once in a while a obby item kinda like rs2 but not as hard to get, anyways i'd also like the shops here to make you have to use tokkul to buy obby weapons.
Any help will be greatly appreciated or even a guess ~Legit Gltich~

item.title: Making ONE shop use Tokkul
item.dc:creator: @Ziege_Terra_117 Ziege Terra 117
item.description:
@Ziege_Terra_117 wrote:

Thanks a lot for posting this… i was posting topics asking how to do this, and I searched ‘Tokkul’ in the search bar, and found this… But thanks again for posting, it works good too

Read full topic

item.title: Making ONE shop use Tokkul
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

NOTE: Back up your files before attempting this. There are glitches with this, and I repeat, I do NOT take any credits for this. If you want to look at the real guide, its under the C&P section of R~Locus. I suggest you take a look at it.

In your client.java, search for:

} else if (interfaceID == 3823) { //Show value to sell items

It should come up with something like this:

if (ShopValue <= 1) { ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot)); } if (ShopValue >= 1000 && ShopValue < 1000000) { ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000) + "K)"; } else if (ShopValue >= 1000000) { ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000000) + " million)"; }

Under the last }, add this code

if (MyShopID == %%) { sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": Shop will buy for "+ ShopValue + " &&&&&&&" + ShopAdd); } else { sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": Shop will buy for "+ ShopValue + " coins" + ShopAdd); } } }

The % is going to be the ID of your shop.
The &&&&&&& is the name of the currency. We will be using Tokkul for this.

Your code should now look something like this:

if (ShopValue <= 1) { ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot)); } if (ShopValue >= 1000 && ShopValue < 1000000) { ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000) + "K)"; } else if (ShopValue >= 1000000) { ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000000) + " million)"; } if (MyShopID == 1) { sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": Shop will buy for "+ ShopValue + " Tokkul" + ShopAdd); } else { sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": Shop will buy for "+ ShopValue + " coins" + ShopAdd); } }

Depending on your server you MAY have to change the amount of brackets.

Now, search for something like this:

} else if (interfaceID == 3900) { //Show value to buy items

You should see something like this

if (WanneShop > -1) { int ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot)); String ShopAdd = ""; if (ShopValue <= 1) { ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot)); } if (ShopValue >= 1000 && ShopValue < 1000000) { ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000) + "K)"; } else if (ShopValue >= 1000000) { ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000000) + " million)"; }

Under the last } add

if (MyShopID == 1) { sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs "+ ShopValue + " tokkul" + ShopAdd); } else { sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs "+ ShopValue + " coins" + ShopAdd); } }

Your code should now look like this

} else if (interfaceID == 3900) { //Show value to buy items if (WanneShop > -1) { int ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot)); String ShopAdd = ""; if (ShopValue <= 1) { ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot)); } if (ShopValue >= 1000 && ShopValue < 1000000) { ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000) + "K)"; } else if (ShopValue >= 1000000) { ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000000) + " million)"; } if (MyShopID == 9 || MyShopID == 10 || MyShopID == 11) { sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs "+ ShopValue + " tokkul" + ShopAdd); } else { sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs "+ ShopValue + " coins" + ShopAdd); }

Now, search for

public boolean sellItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {

Under that you should see:

if (amount > 0 && itemID == (playerItems[fromSlot] - 1)) { if (server.shopHandler.ShopSModifier[MyShopID] > 1) { boolean IsIn = false; for (int i = 0; i <= server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]; i++) { if (itemID == (server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][i] - 1)) { IsIn = true; break; } }

Under the last } add

if (MyShopID == 1) { sendMessage("You cannot sell " + GetItemName(itemID) + " in this store."); return false; } if (IsIn == false) { sendMessage( "You cannot sell " + GetItemName(itemID) + " in this store."); return false; } }

Your code will now look like this

public boolean sellItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { if (amount > 0 && itemID == (playerItems[fromSlot] - 1)) { if (server.shopHandler.ShopSModifier[MyShopID] > 1) { boolean IsIn = false; for (int i = 0; i <= server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]; i++) { if (itemID == (server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][i] - 1)) { IsIn = true; break; } } if (MyShopID == 1) { sendMessage("You cannot sell " + GetItemName(itemID) + " in this store."); return false; } if (IsIn == false) { sendMessage( "You cannot sell " + GetItemName(itemID) + " in this store."); return false; } }

NEXT, search for

addItem(995, TotPrice2);

You should see something like this:

for (int i = amount; i > 0; i--) { TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 1, fromSlot)); if (freeSlots() > 0) { if (Item.itemIsNote[itemID] == false) { deleteItem(itemID, GetItemSlot(itemID), 1); } else { deleteItem(itemID, fromSlot, 1); } addItem(995, TotPrice2); addShopItem(itemID, 1); } else { sendMessage("Not enough space in your inventory."); break; } }

ABOVE for (int i = amount; i > 0; i--) {

add

			if (MyShopID != 1) {

Then add another bracket to the end of the code. It should now look like this:

if (MyShopID == 1) { for (int i = amount; i > 0; i--) { TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 1, fromSlot)); if (freeSlots() > 0) { if (Item.itemIsNote[itemID] == false) { deleteItem(itemID, GetItemSlot(itemID), 1); } else { deleteItem(itemID, fromSlot, 1); } addItem(6529, TotPrice2); addShopItem(itemID, 1); } else { sendMessage("Not enough space in your inventory."); break; } } }

Search for

public boolean buyItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {

Your code will be something like this:

public boolean buyItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { if (amount > 0 && itemID == (server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] - 1)) { if (amount > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot]) { amount = server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot]; } double ShopValue; double TotPrice; int TotPrice2; int Overstock; int Slot = 0; for (int i = amount; i > 0; i--) { TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 0, fromSlot)); Slot = GetItemSlot(995); if (Slot == -1) { sendMessage("You don't have enough coins."); break; }

under

int Slot = 0;

add

int Slot2 = 0;

Change the

if (Slot == -1) { sendMessage("You don't have enough coins."); break; }

to this

if (Slot == -1 && MyShopID != 1) { sendMessage("You don't have enough coins."); break; }

and under that add this

else if (Slot2 == -1 && MyShopID == 1) { sendMessage("You don't have enough tokkul."); break; }

The code should look something like this

[code] public boolean buyItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
if (amount > 0 && itemID == (server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] - 1)) {
if (amount > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot]) {
amount = server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot];
}
double ShopValue;
double TotPrice;
int TotPrice2;
int Overstock;
int Slot = 0;
int Slot2 = 0;
for (int i = amount; i > 0; i–) {
TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 0, fromSlot));
Slot = GetItemSlot(995);
Slot2 = GetItemSlot(6529);

			if (Slot == -1 && MyShopID != 9 && MyShopID != 10 && MyShopID != 11) {
				sendMessage("You don't have enough coins.");
				break;
			}

   			else if (Slot2 == -1 && MyShopID == 9 && MyShopID == 10 && MyShopID == 11) {
     		sendMessage("You don't have enough tokkul.");
      		break;
    			 }[/code]

Under that look for this

if(TotPrice2 <= 1) { TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 0, fromSlot)); } if (playerItemsN[Slot] >= TotPrice2) { if (freeSlots() > 0) { deleteItem(995, GetItemSlot(995), TotPrice2); addItem(itemID, 1); server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1; server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) { server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { sendMessage("Not enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { sendMessage("You don't have enough coins."); break; } }

Change all of that to this

if(TotPrice2 <= 1) { TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 0, fromSlot)); } if (MyShopID != 1) { if (playerItemsN[Slot] >= TotPrice2) { if (freeSlots() > 0) { deleteItem(995, GetItemSlot(995), TotPrice2); addItem(itemID, 1); server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1; server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) { server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { sendMessage("Not enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { sendMessage("You don't have enough coins."); } }

and under that, add this

[code] if (MyShopID == 1) {
if (playerItemsN[Slot2] >= TotPrice2) {
if (freeSlots() > 0) {
deleteItem(6529, GetItemSlot(6529), TotPrice2);
addItem(itemID, 1);
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1;
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) {
server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
}
} else {
sendMessage(“Not enough space in your inventory.”);
break;
}
} else {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough Tokkul.”);
}
}

  }[/code]

There are glitches with this, and I repeat, I do NOT take any credits for this. If you want to look at the real guide, its under the C&P section of R~Locus. I suggest you take a look at it.

Read full topic

Hello, might have seen my post earlier but i’m in the process of fixing my Fighting Caves area
and i have if you kill any tzhaar monster you get some tokkul and once in a while a obby item
kinda like rs2 but not as hard to get, anyways i’d also like the shops here to make you have to use tokkul
